contents: Article 14 (Executive Recommendation Committee) ① Recommend candidates for executives of the Corporation (excluding executive directors and ex officio directors) and discuss matters related to the contract with the chairman candidate notified by the Board of Directors in accordance with the provisions of Article 31 (1) of the Public Institutions Management Act In order to carry out the following, an executive recommendation committee is established in the Corporation. Revised January 5, 2022, ② The number of members of the Executive Recommendation Committee shall be determined by resolution of the Board of Directors within the range of 5 to 15. ③ The Executive Recommendation Committee shall be composed of non-executive directors and members appointed by the Board of Directors., ④ Executives The chairman of the Recommendation Committee is elected by unanimous vote from among the members who are non-executive directors., ⑤ The number of members appointed by the Board of Directors shall be less than one-half of the number of members of the Executive Recommendation Committee., ⑥ The Executive Recommendation Committee requires the approval of a majority of registered members. ⑦ Other matters related to the composition and operation of the Executive Recommendation Committee are determined by the “Operating Regulations of the Executive Recommendation Committee.”
